sen.j: 俳名（はい-みょう）は、本来俳号と同義であるが、江戸時代中期以降の芸能分野において次のように用いられた。
sen.e: Haimyo is originally synonymous with Haigo (the pen name of a haiku poet), but it was used as 1. a name freely used by kabuki actors both in public and private matters, apart from their family name which they used on the stage (stage name), or 2. a term equivalent to what is called a stage name today, derived from the definition 1 above,in the field of public entertainment after the mid Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Haimyo is originally synonymous with Haigo (the pen name of a haiku poet), but it was used as follows in the field of public entertainment after the mid Edo period: 1. a name (pseudonym) freely used by kabuki actors both in public and private matters, apart from their family name which they used on the stage (stage name), or 2. a term equivalent to what is called a stage name today, derived from the definition 1 above.
sen.cmt: 「（号）」の訳が抜けていたので、「(pseudonym)」を追加。読みにくいので、語順を変更。一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.cmt: 「次のように用いられた。」とし、後列の箇条書きを分割しました。

sen.j: 1. 歌舞伎役者が舞台の上で使う名跡（芸名）とは別に、公私にわたって自由に使用した名（号）。
sen.e: 1. a name (pseudonym) freely used by kabuki actors both in public and private matters, apart from their family name which they used on the stage (stage name)
sen.cmt: 箇条書きの部分を分割しました。

sen.j: 2. 1の用法から転じて、現在言うところの「芸名」に相当する語。
